info.title: SHARE API Documentation
info.description: The SHARE API allows you to access all Research Release Events in the SHARE database and publish your organization's publications, data, repository holdings, or other research directly to SHARE.  The API has three endpoints.  “search,” “data,” and “stats.”  “search” allows you to access information in SHARE, “data” allows you to post to SHARE, and “stats” gives metrics on the different providers in SHARE.

get.description: Normalized SHARE Data from all content providers

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Any valid Lucene query string matching the SHARE schema

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
The starting index of the search. Indexing begins at 0.
If you set the size to 100, to page through the results,
you would increase your from by increments of 100. Defaults to 0.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Determines the number of results returned at a time. Defaults to 10.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Determines what value the results are sorted on.
If not provided, it defaults to sorting based on the relevance
score computed by Elasticsearch.

parameters.name: v
parameters.description: Version of the metadata to retrieve. v=1 will retrieve an older version of the metadata, which currently powers the SHARE Search page.

post.description: POST endpoint for sending pre-formatted data to SHARE. Requires an API key - contact us at share-support@osf.io for more information.

parameters.name: contributors
parameters.description: The people or organizations responsible for making contributions to an object. Each contributor is either a person or an organization.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: A textual description of the resource.

parameters.name: providerUpdatedDateTime
parameters.description: The date and time the provider describing the object has been updated about either the creation or update of an object by its contributors. E.g., this may be the date a manuscript is published, but not necessarily the date the manuscript was written.

parameters.name: freeToRead
parameters.description: An object consisting of a date range specifying when this research object will be free to read.

parameters.name: languages
parameters.description: The language of the resouce, in a 3 letter pattern

parameters.name: licenses
parameters.description: The licenses under which the object has been released. Can be an array of multiple licenses.

parameters.name: publisher
parameters.description: This element contains the name of the entity, typically a 'publisher', responsible for making the version of record of the resource available. This could be a person, organisation or service

parameters.name: sponsorships
parameters.description: Sponsorships associated with the array. Can consist of an award, or a sponsoring organization.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title and any sub-titles of the resource.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: This element indicates which 'version' of the resource is being described. While intended primarily for journal articles, it might be applicable to other types of resources as well.

parameters.name: otherProperties
parameters.description: Structured or unstructured properties that don't fall into the general schema

parameters.name: shareProperties
parameters.description: Structured or unstructured properties that don't fall into the general schema, and are for SHARE general use

get.description:
Elasticsearch aggregations of SHARE data, using the pre-beta metadata schema. Includes the results of the
pre-defined aggregations used to generate the dynaimic graphs on the
SHARE Search page located on the OSF.
 This API endpoint returns metadata in an older version of the schema, so may not prove immedtiately useful for anyone looking for more than basic aggregations of the data, including source information.

title.description:
This refers to the title, and any sub-titles,
of the resource. The title should be represented using the original
spelling and wording. If the resource really has no title, then this
element must still be supplied, though it may be empty

canonicalUri.description: The preferred persistent HTTP URI that represents the research object. This should be repeated in exactly one other field in the uris object.

providerUris.description: The persistent HTTP URI that points to the object's record at the SHARE provider regardless of format.

descriptorUris.description: A persistent HTTP URI that points to a description of the research object.

objectUris.description: A persistent HTTP URI that points directly to the research object.

description.description: An abstract or general description of the resource.

tags.description: Non-hierarchical terms or keywords assigned to an object to aid browsing or searching.

providerUpdatedDateTime.description: The date and time the provider describing the object has been updated about either the creation or update of an object by its contributors. E.g., this may be the date a manuscript is published, but not necessarily the date the manuscript was written.

freeToRead.description: A date range specifying when this research object will be free to read.

startDate.description:
The start date of the free to read period.
If the resource was always free to read, then this date can
be the same as creationDate or the date '0000-00-00'

endDate.description: The date on which this resource will no longer be free to read

languages.description: The primary languages in which the content of the resource is presented. Values used for this element MUST conform to ISO 639–3. This offers two and three letter tags e.g. "en" or "eng" for English and "en-GB" for English used in the UK.
